intro: Senecio manguensis, commonly known as the Manguense groundsels, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks and in forest understories. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range from yellow to orange in color. Senecio manguensis is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained soil with partial to full shade.
